snippet: In the too-big-to-fail parade, what about a closer look at the asset management firms that oversee trillions of investor dollars?
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column says paper by Financial Stability Board and International Organization of Securities Commissioners lays out how regulators plan to identify financial entities that are not banks or insurance firms but nonetheless are systemically significant and whose failure could pose threat; points out that $53 trillion is overseen by United States money management industry.
lead_paragraph: In the too-big-to-fail parade, what about a closer look at the asset management firms that oversee trillions of investor dollars?

headline.main: Bailout Risk, Far Beyond the Banks
headline.print_headline: Bailout Risk, Far Beyond The Banks

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
